data.title: Events in Sports History in 1965
data.meta_description: Events in sport in 1965. See what famous, scandalous and notable sporting events happened in 1965 or search by date or keyword.
data.text:
31st Orange Bowl: #5 Texas beats #1 Alabama, 21-17

Jan 1 31st Sugar Bowl: #7 LSU beats Syracuse, 13-10

Jan 1 49-year-old former England international soccer forward Stanley Matthews becomes only player to be awarded a knighthood while still playing (Stoke City)

Jan 1 51st Rose Bowl: #4 Michigan beats #8 Oregon State, 34-7

Jets Sign Namath

New York Jets sign future Pro Football Hall of Fame quarterback Joe Namath to a $427,000 contract over three years (pro football record at the time)

15th NFL Pro Bowl

15th NFL Pro Bowl, LA Memorial Coliseum: Western Conference beats Eastern Conference, 34-14; MVPs: Fran Tarkenton, Minnesota Vikings, QB; Terry Barr, Detroit Lions, DB

15th NBA All-Star Game

15th NBA All-Star Game, St. Louis Arena, St. Louis, Mo: East beats West, 124-123; MVP: Jerry Lucas, Cincinnati Royals, F

Warriors Trade Chamberlain

One of the biggest trades in NBA history; San Francisco Warriors send Wilt Chamberlain to the Philadelphia 76ers for Connie Dierking, Lee Shaffer, Paul Neumann and cash

4th AFL All Star Game, Jeppeson Stadium, Houston: Western Division beats Eastern Division, 38-14; MVPs: Keith Lincoln, LA Chargers, RB; Willie Brown, Denver Broncos, DB

Celtics Lose to 76ers

Boston Celtics' center Bill Russell misses all 14 shots in 104-100 loss to Philadelphia 76ers, led by newly acquired Wilt Chamberlain

19th century pitcher James 'Pud' Galvin elected to Baseball Hall of Fame

Emerson's Third Title

Australian Championship Men's Tennis: Roy Emerson wins 3rd consecutive Australian title; beats fellow Australian Fred Stolle 7-9, 2-6, 6-4, 7-5, 6-1

Smith's 6th Straight Win

Australian Championships Women's Tennis: Australian Margaret Smith wins 6th straight home singles title; beats Maria Bueno of Brazil 5-7, 6-4, 5-2; Bueno retired injured

Patterson vs. Chuvalo

Former world heavyweight boxing champion Floyd Patterson beats Canadian George Chuvalo by unanimous decision in a 12-round non-title clash at New York’s Madison Square Garden; 'The Ring' names bout Fight of the Year.

Braves offer Milwaukee $500,000 to terminate their lease a year earlier, the proposal is turned down

Braves propose to pay 5 cents from each ticket to bring a new team to Milwaukee

Sports History

US female Figure Skating championship won by Peggy Fleming

7th Daytona 500: Fred Lorenzen wins driving for Holman-Moody; race ends on lap 133 due to persistent rain

Sports History

US-Japan baseball relations suspended over Masanori Murakami dispute

NFL adds 6th official - the line judge

Olympic Gold

Australian swimming authorities suspend triple Olympic gold medal winning sprinter Dawn Fraser for 10 years for misconduct at the 1964 Tokyo Olympics

Ernie Terrell beats Eddie Machen by unanimous points decision over 15 rounds in Chicago, Illinois to win vacant WBA heavyweight boxing title

12th ACC Men's Basketball Tournament: NC State beats Duke, 91-85

Mar 6 Bruce Taylor hits 105 for NZ v India in 1st Test Cricket innings

27th NCAA Men's Basketball Championship: UCLA beats Michigan, 91-80; Bruins' back-to-back National titles; Gail Goodrich 42 points

Mar 20 Wales misses out on a 4th Grand Slam after losing to France, 22-13 at Stade Colombes, Paris despite winning the Five Nations Rugby Championship

119th Grand National: Tommy Smith becomes first American jockey to win GN aboard US trained and owned horse, Jay Trump at 100/6

Baseball Record

1st baseball game at Houston Astrodome, Astros beat NY Yankees 2-1 in exhibition as Mickey Mantle hits MLB's 1st indoor homerun; US President Lyndon Johnson and wife Lady Bird attend

US Masters Golf

29th US Masters Tournament, Augusta National GC: Jack Nicklaus wins the 2nd of his 6 Masters titles with a tournament record 271 (−17); beats Gary Player and Arnold Palmer by a record 9 strokes

1st regular season MLB game at Houston Astrodome; visiting Philadelphia Phillies beat Astros 2-0

NFL changes penalty flag from white to bright gold

69th Boston Marathon won by Morio Shigematsu of Japan in race record 2:16:33

19th NBA Championship: Boston Celtics beat LA Lakers, 4 games to 1

Lindsey Nelson broadcasts baseball game at Houston Astrodome from a hanging gondola

Kentucky Derby

91st Kentucky Derby: Bill Shoemaker wins aboard Lucky Debonair, the third of his 4 Derby victories

May 1 Stanley Cup, Montreal Forum, Montreal, Quebec: Dick Duff has a goal and 2 assists as Montreal Canadiens beat Chicago Blackhawks, 4-0 in Game 7 to take title 4-3

Baseball Record

San Francisco Giants Willie Mays hit 512th career home run breaking Mel Ott's 29 year-old National League record, off of Los Angeles Dodgers Claude Osteen at Candlestick Park [1]

Bill Lawry (210) & Bob Simpson (201) complete record opening stand of 382 in Australia's 1st innings, drawn 4th Test v West Indies in Bridgetown

Sports History

Jerry Sloan is selected by the Baltimore Bullets as the fourth overall pick of the 1965 NBA draft

West Indies becomes 1st holders of the Frank Worrell Cricket Trophy

90th Preakness: Ron Turcotte aboard Tom Rolfe wins in 1:56.2

May 15 Canadian Football Players Association organizes

Baseball History

Baltimore Oriole Jim Palmer's pitching debut, beats Yankees 7-5 & homers

West Ham United of England win 5th European Cup Winner's Cup against 1860 München of West Germany 2-0 in London

Ali Floors The Bear in Just Two Minutes

Muhammad Ali KOs Sonny Liston at 2:12 of round 1 at Central Maine Civic Center, Lewiston to retain his WBC/WBA heavyweight boxing title

10th European Cup Final, San Siro, Milan: Jair da Costa scores winner as defending champions Internazionale beat Benfica, 1-0

World Record

American long jumper Ralph Boston sets then world record 27' 4 3/4" (8.35m) at Modesto, California

French Open Men's Tennis

French Championships Men's Tennis: Fred Stolle beats fellow Australian Tony Roche 3-6, 6-0, 6-2, 6-3 for his first Grand Slam singles title

May 29 French Championships Women's Tennis: Australian Lesley Turner Bowrey wins her 2nd French singles crown; upsets doubles partner Margaret Smith 6-3, 6-4

May 29 Phillies Dick Allen hits 529' HR out of Connie Mack Stadium

Indy 500

Indianapolis 500: Scottish F1 driver Jim Clark becomes first foreigner in 49 years to win; only driver in history to win Indy 500 and F1 World C'ship in the same year

Robert Manry begins his 78 day voyage to sail a 13.5-foot yacht "Tinkerbelle" across the Atlantic Ocean

97th Belmont: John Sellers aboard Hail to All wins in 2:28.6

Yankees Tom Tresh bangs 3 consecutive HRs beating White Sox 12-0

MLB Draft: Kansas City Athletics A's select Arizona State University outfielder Rick Monday #1; inaugural MLB Draft

Morio Shigematsu of Japan runs world record marathon (2:12:00) in the Polytechnic Marathon in London, England

LPGA Western Open Women's Golf, Beverly CC: Susie Maxwell wins by 3 strokes ahead of runner-up Marlene Hagge

Cincinnati Reds pitcher Jim Maloney no-hits New York Mets but loses in 11 innings, 1-0

Baseball Record

Detroit pitcher Denny McLain in relief strikes out first 7 batters faced & records 14 in 6 2/3 innings in Tigers 6-5 win over Boston Red Sox; Bill Freehan ties catcher record of 19 putouts

US Golf Open

US Open Men's Golf, Bellerive CC: Gary Player of South Africa beats Australian Kel Nagle by 3 strokes in an 18-hole playoff to win his only US Open title; completes his career Grand Slam at age 29

Freddie Trueman ends his Test cricket career, v NZ at Lord's

Sports History

NFL Commissioner Pete Rozelle grants ownership of the Atlanta Falcons to Rankin Smith Sr., Executive VP of Life Insurance Company of Georgia; Rankin pays then-record $8.5 million

Wimbledon Men's Tennis: Roy Emerson scores second consecutive title win over fellow Australian Fred Stolle 6-2, 6-4, 6-4

Wimbledon Women's Tennis: Australian Margaret Smith beats Maria Bueno of Brazil 6-4, 7-5, her second of 3 Wimbledon singles titles

US Women's Golf Open

US Open Women's Golf, Atlantic City CC: Carol Mann wins by 2 shots from fellow American Kathy Cornelius

Sports History

Joe Morgan is 1st Houston player with 6 hits in a game

British Golf Open

British Open Men's Golf, Royal Birkdale GC: Australian Peter Thomson Peter Thomson wins his 5th Claret Jug, 2 strokes clear of runners-up Brian Huggett and Christy O'Connor Snr

Sports History

36th MLB All Star Game, Metropolitan Stadium, Minnesota: NL wins, 6-5; MVP: Juan Marichal, SF Giants, P

52nd Tour de France: In his first year as a professional, Italian Felice Gimondi, a replacement on the Salvarani team, captures overall title ahead of Raymond Poulidor

Baseball History

NY Yankee pitcher Mel Stottlemyre hits an inside-the-park grand slam

Dick Stuart homers in a major league-record 23rd different park

Casey Stengel Resigns

Casey Stengel resigns as manager of NY Mets

Major league record 26 strikeouts, Phillies (16), Pirates (10)

MLB Milwaukee Brewers manager Bobby Bragan says his pitchers threw 75 to 80 spitballs in a 9-2 loss to the San Francisco Giants

Scottish Lotus driver Jim Clark wins the German Grand Prix at the Nürburgring to clinch his second F1 World Drivers Championship

South African cricket batsman Graeme Pollock scores a classic 125 to set the Proteas on the way to a 2nd Test win against England at Trent Bridge

32nd NFL Chicago College All-Star Game: Cleveland 24, All-Stars 16; 68,000 at Soldier Field

Milwaukee Brewers Baseball Club, Inc applies for a NL franchise

Japanese community of San Francisco holds Masanori Murakami Day at Candlestick Park to honor 1st Japanese player to play in major leagues

Aug 15 PGA Championship Men's Golf, Laurel Valley GC: Dave Marr wins his only major title, beating Billy Casper and Jack Nicklaus by 2 strokes

Miami Dolphins Franchise

American Football League's 9th franchise is officially awarded to Joe Robbie and television star Danny Thomas; Miami Dolphins start play in AFL's Eastern Division in 1966

Dutch soccer team FC Den Bosch (successor to BVV 1906 and Wilhelmina 1890) is established at 's-Hertogenbosch

Baseball History

Hank Aaron loses a HR, because he hit it out of batter's box

Baseball History

Orioles' Brooks Robinson hits into his third career triple play (tying George Sisler, Deacon McGuire and Joe Start)

Cincinnati Reds pitcher Jim Maloney throws his second no-hitter of the season in 1-0 win over the Chicago Cubs

Eddie Mathews and Hank Aaron (1954-65) pass Babe Ruth and Lou Gehrig hitting 772 HRs while playing together on the same team

San Francisco Giants pitcher Juan Marachal hits LA Dodger catcher John Roseboro on the head with his bat causing a 14 minute brawl

San Francisco GiantsWillie Mays sets NL record for HRs in a month with his 17th of August

Casey Stengel announces his retirement after 55 years in baseball

Baseball History

Chicago Cubs slugger Ernie Banks hits his MLB 400th career HR (off Curt Simmons) in 5-3 win over St. Louis at Wrigley Field; Simmons also gave up Willie Mays' 400th HR in 1963

Preparing a move to Anaheim, the Los Angeles Angels change their name to the California Angels

Baseball History

Kansas City A's Bert Campaneris plays all 9 positions in a game

Baseball Record

LA Dodgers future Baseball Hall of Fame pitcher Sandy Koufax throws his 4th career no-hitter and first perfect game in a 1-0 win over the Chicago Cubs at Dodger Stadium

Phillies 10,000th game to a decision since 1900, Phils beat Cards

Braves 2nd straight one-hitter against the Mets

US Open Women's Tennis

US National Championship Women's Tennis, Forest Hills, NY: Australian Margaret Smith wins her second of 5 US singles titles; beats American rival Billie Jean Moffitt 8-6, 7-5

Sep 12 US National Championship Women's Tennis, Forest Hills, NY: Spaniard Manuel Santana beats Cliff Drysdale of South Africa 6-2, 7-9, 7-5, 6-1 for his lone US singles crown

Willie Mays's 500th HR (off Don Nottebart), Giants 11th straight win

Boston Red Sox Dave Morehead no-hits Cleveland Indians, 2-0

Mickey Mantle Day at Yankee Stadium: Mantle play his 2,000th game

Sports History

60-year-old Satchel Paige of Kansas City Athletics pitches 3 scoreless innings

LPGA Championship

LPGA Championship Women's Golf, Stardust CC: Sandra Haynie wins by 1 stroke from Clifford Ann Creed

Phillies catcher Pat Corrales sets record by reaching base twice on catcher's interference in one game & 6 times in one season

Baseball History

LA Dodger Don Drysdale (23-12) wins 13th straight game, 7 by shutouts

NY Yankees pitcher Mel Stottlemyre wins game #20

Cubs lose season finale 6-3 to Pirates; Ernie Banks-Don Kessinger combine to tie MLB record of 3 triple plays in a season

Oct 3 Dual Melbourne Cup winning Australian jockey Pat Glennon rides French colt Sea Bird to victory in the Prix de l'Arc De Triomphe to claim an impressive double after the thoroughbred's English Derby win

Sports History

Whitey Ford notches win #232 in season ending 11-5 victory v Boston Red Sox; becomes Yankees' winningest pitcher

Ryder Cup

Ryder Cup, Royal Birkdale GC: US beats Great Britain 19½-12½; Byron Nelson non-playing American captain; Harry Weetman GB skipper

Baseball World Series: LA Dodgers edge Minnesota Twins, 2-0 in Game 7 at Metropolitan Stadium; Dodgers 3rd title since move to LA; MVP: LA pitcher Sandy Koufax

NHL All-Star Game

19th NHL All-Star Game, Montreal Forum, Montreal, QC: All-Stars beat Montreal Canadiens, 5-2; MVP: Henri Richard, Montreal, C

Jim Clark in a Lotus is forced to retire from season-ending Mexican Grand Prix at Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez with engine trouble; American Richie Ginther is race winner and Clark claims his second F1 World Drivers Championship

Ernie Terrell retains WBA heavyweight boxing title; beats Canadian George Chuvalo in 15 round points decision in Toronto

Sports History

Craig Breedlove driving FIA-legal four-wheeler, Sonic I, breaks land speed record with a two-run average of 555.483 mph (893.963 km/h) at the Bonneville Salt Flats, Utah

Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Sandy Koufax is named Cy Young Award winner by a unanimous vote and for a third time; posts 26-8 record, 1.73 ERA and record-shattering 382 strikeouts

1st NY Knick game postponed (black-out) vs St Louis

Nov 9 San Francisco Giants outfielder Willie Mays named NL MVP

Craig Breedlove sets land speed record (600.601 mph-966.57 kph)

William Eckert is unanimously elected commissioner of baseball

Ali vs. Patterson

In his second title defense, Muhammad Ali scores 12th-round KO of Floyd Patterson at Las Vegas Convention Center to retain his world heavyweight boxing championship

31st Heisman Trophy Award: Mike Garrett, Southern Cal (RB)

Dodgers 2nd baseman Jim Lefebvre is voted NL Rookie of Year

1966 NFL Draft: University of Texas linebacker Tommy Nobis #1 pick by Atlanta Falcons

Nov 27 30th Iron Bowl: Alabama beats Auburn 30-3 in Birmingham

Nov 27 CFL Grey Cup, CNE Stadium, Toronto: Hamilton Tiger-Cats defeat Winn Blue Bombers, 22-16; strong winds meant all scoring occurred by the team going with the wind

2nd NY Knicks game postponed (due to death of opponent 76ers' owner)

Dec 4 San Francisco Giant Masanori Murakami, 4-1 this year, does not renew his contract signing instead with the Nankai Hawks of Osaka for $40,000

Test Cricket debut of Doug Walters v England at the Gabba

Dec 12 Doug Walters makes maiden Test ton in 1st Test, goes on to 155

William Eckert replaces Ford Frick as 4th Commissioner of Baseball

AFL Championship, Balboa Stadium San Diego: Buffalo Bills beat San Diego Chargers 23-0; repeat previous year's win over SD

Ballon d'Or: Benfica striker Eusébio wins award for best European football player; first Portuguese national to win, and still only Benfica player

CBS purchases NFL TV rights for 1966-68 at $18.8 million per year
